column5: TAIPEI Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC)  the world's top contract chip maker  said on Monday it has signed an agreement with the Nanjing City Government to invest $3 billion building an advanced wafer manufacturing facility in China.

column4: Origin withdraws offer to buy Affymetrix
column5: Origin Technologies Corp  owned by Affymetrix Inc's  former employees  withdrew its offer to buy the gene-sequencing products maker  hours after Affymetrix said on Monday that Origin's raised bid was not superior to Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc's  proposal.

column4: Affymetrix backs Thermo Fisher deal
column5: March 28 Gene sequencing products maker Affymetrix Inc said on Monday that a raised offer from its former executives does not constitute a superior proposal and backed its deal to be acquired by Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc.

column4: Total Port Arthur refinery shutting units for work: sources
column5: HOUSTON Total SA began shutting a 60 000 barrel per day (bpd)coking unit on Monday at the company's 225 500 bpd Port Arthur  Texas  refinery for a planned overhaul that could last up to 60 days  said sources familiar with plant operations.

column4: Judge rejects chiropractors' claims against UnitedHealth
column5: A federal judge has dismissed underpayment claims brought against insurer UnitedHealth Group Inc on behalf of a proposed class of out-of-network chiropractors  finding that they cannot sue in place of patients under the federal Employee Retirement Income Security Act.

column4: Valeant CEO subpoenaed to testify before U.S. Senate panel
column5: WASHINGTON The chief executive of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  which is under scrutiny for dramatically hiking the price of older drugs  has been summoned to testify at a U.S. congressional hearing on April 27  the panel said on Monday.

column4: U.S. court strikes down Puerto Rico tax on Wal-Mart
column5: A U.S. district court judge on Monday struck down a tax levied by Puerto Rico on retailer Wal-Mart Stores   dealing a blow to the debt-laden U.S. territory's efforts to shore up its finances.

column4: Buffett boosts Berkshire's Wells Fargo stake to 10 percent
column5: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  on Monday said it has increased its ownership stake in Wells Fargo & Co  to 10 percent  a level that could mean increased federal scrutiny over the investment.

column4: New U.S. sanctions a headache for companies linked to North Korean gold
column5: WASHINGTON  March 28 More than two dozen U.S.-listed companies have links to North Korean gold in their supply chains  according to regulatory disclosures reviewed by Reuters  potentially putting them at risk of penalties under tough new U.S. sanctions against Pyongyang's mining sector.

column4: Woori Bank nears settlement with Citi over subprime losses
column5: South Korea's Woori Bank has reached a settlement in principle to resolve claims that a Citigroup Inc unit induced it to buy $25 million in risky securities that plunged in value during the financial crisis.
